newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU agrees six month extension for IRI on debt.
newsitem.headline: EU agrees six month extension for IRI on debt.

text.p: The European Commission said on Wednesday it had agreed to give Italian industrial holding company IRI six more months to reduce its debt to levels agreed between the Commission and Italy in 1992.
The two sides originally agreed that IRI would reduce its debt progressively by the end of 1996.

The Commission said the extension was subject to several commitments by the Italian government, including the sale of Stet Telecommunications to the Treasury and privatisation of the highway-toll company Autostrade, the maritime transport company Finmare and yellow pages publisher Seat.
The Commission said those actions would allow IRI to reduce its debt to about 19 trillion lire.
